optimTFE 1.0.0

Generate summary statistics for optimization solutions

Source: R/generate_summary.R
generate_summary.Rd

This function calculates various summary statistics for optimization solutions, including unit counts, suitability metrics, species richness, and spatial metrics (when spatial data is provided).

Usage

generate_summary(
  data = NULL,
  out_dir = ".",
  run_id = "optimTFE",
  suitability_mx = suitability_mx,
  unit_ids = unit_ids,
  spatial = spatial,
  spatial_projection = NULL,
  min_units_plot = file.path(out_dir, run_id, "n_units.pdf"),
  summary_out = file.path(out_dir, run_id, "summary.csv"),
  return_df = FALSE
)

Arguments

data

Dataframe containing solution data. If NULL, data will be loaded from the specified output directory.

out_dir

Character string specifying the output directory path. Default is ".".

run_id

Character string specifying the run identifier. Default is "optimTFE".

suitability_mx

Matrix of suitability values with unit IDs as row names and species as column names.

unit_ids

Vector of unit IDs (must be in the same order as the rows of suitability_mx).

spatial

Spatial data frame (sf object) containing geometries for planning units.

spatial_projection

CRS object or string for transforming spatial data to an equal area projection if needed.

min_units_plot

Character string specifying the output path for the minimum units plot description (default = `file.path(out_dir, run_id, "n_units.pdf")`).

summary_out

Character string specifying the output path for the summary data frame (default = `file.path(out_dir, run_id, "summary.csv")`).

return_df

Logical value indicating whether to return the summary data frame.

Value

A data frame with summary statistics for each solution, including number of units, mean/median suitability, species richness metrics, and spatial metrics (area and perimeter) if spatial data is provided.
